decks.notes: The deck aims to assemble the combo of Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace to draw the entire deck and win the game with Lightning Storm. It uses various cantrips and card selection spells to find the combo pieces quickly, and employs rituals and mana ramp to generate enough mana for the combo. In addition, Phyrexian Unlife can buy extra turns by preventing damage, while Pact of Negation protects the combo from disruption. The deck is fast and resilient, focusing on assembling its key combo as quickly as possible to secure the win.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mixture of efficient creatures and disruption spells in the Abzan color combination. It aims to put pressure on opponents with early threats like Tarmogoyf and Grim Flayer, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck also has a strong mid to late game presence with powerful cards like Siege Rhino and Liliana of the Veil. It aims to outvalue and outpace opponents with a mix of creature aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Noble Hierarch and Eldrazi Temple to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. It also includes disruption and removal spells like Path to Exile and Ancient Stirrings to control the board and prevent the opponent from stabilizing. The combination of efficient creatures and disruption allows the deck to apply pressure early in the game and maintain it throughout, making it a formidable Aggro deck in the Modern format.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on card advantage, disruption, and versatility to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By utilizing a mix of card draw, removal spells, counterspells, and powerful creatures like Tasigur and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to maintain control of the board and outvalue the opponent over the course of the game. The deck's mana base is optimized for efficient fixing and consistency, allowing for smooth gameplay and the ability to play powerful spells across all three colors.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures while using cards like Noble Hierarch and Eldrazi Temple to power them out quickly. Cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher disrupt the opponent's plans while Drowner of Hope provides additional aggression and utility. The deck also includes control elements like Engineered Explosives and Path to Exile to deal with threats and ensure the Eldrazi can continue to attack unimpeded. Overall, the goal is to quickly establish a board presence and dominate the game with aggressive plays.

A Modern 1 vs 1 deck focused on aggressive gameplay using Death's Shadow as a powerful threat. The deck aims to control the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while using powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command to clear the way for Death's Shadow. Traverse the Ulvenwald helps find key cards, while Mishra's Bauble and Street Wraith enable the use of Death's Shadow's ability. The deck also includes Tarmogoyf for additional threats and Liliana, the Last Hope for added utility.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling a powerful board presence by aggressively lowering your own life total to pump up Death's Shadow while disrupting your opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. Traverse the Ulvenwald helps to find key pieces of the deck, while removal spells like Tarfire, Kolaghan's Command, Fatal Push, and Abrupt Decay keep your opponent's threats in check. The deck aims to close out the game quickly with large, evasive threats like Tarmogoyf and Death's Shadow, backed up by planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing a mix of efficient threats like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler, along with powerful interaction spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to control the game until it can land a threat that can close out the game. The deck also includes card draw and selection with Serum Visions and Thought Scour to ensure it can maintain its resources and answer the opponent's threats effectively.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures with valuable enters-the-battlefield abilities to disrupt the opponent's game plan and generate incremental advantage. By using cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company, it can tutor up specific creatures at instant speed and put them directly onto the battlefield. The deck also features a combo potential with cards like Melira, Sylvok Outcast and Viscera Seer, allowing for infinite sacrifices or protections. The overall strategy is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently utilizing creature toolbox options and disruptive elements.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through fast, efficient creatures and burn spells. By playing aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear and using burn spells such as Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to 0 before they can stabilize and turn the game in their favor. The deck also includes cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel to punish opponents for casting spells, further adding to the pressure and damage output of the deck.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of burn spells, efficient creatures, and combat tricks. The goal is to put pressure on the opponent early in the game, using cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide to chip away at their life total. The burn spells and creature abilities like Grim Lavamancer are used to finish off the opponent once they are within reach of lethal damage. The deck aims to win before the opponent can stabilize or establish a defense.

This deck is focused on utilizing Death's Shadow as a powerful and aggressive threat, using cards like Mishra's Bauble, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan and clear the way for Death's Shadow to deal massive damage. The deck also includes a toolbox of removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember, as well as versatile cards like Kolaghan's Command and Traverse the Ulvenwald to provide additional flexibility and consistency. Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope provide further support and utility, making this a cohesive and potent aggro deck in Modern.

The deck focuses on aggressively playing low-cost creatures and spells to quickly lower the player's own life total and boost the power of Death's Shadow. By using cards like Street Wraith and Mishra's Bauble to cycle through the deck and manipulate life totals, the player aims to bring out Death's Shadow as a game-ending threat. Additionally, the deck utilizes disruption and removal spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Fatal Push to control the opponent's board while maintaining pressure. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful Death's Shadow and efficient beatdown creatures.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing the player to cast powerful colorless spells such as Wurmcoil Engine, World Breaker, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes board wipes like Oblivion Stone and versatile removal like Collective Brutality to control the game. The goal is to overpower the opponent with big threats while disrupting their strategy with removal and hand disruption.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base and controlling the board through land destruction effects while ramping up its own resources with mana dorks and Utopia Sprawl. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan, eventually overwhelming them with powerful threats like Inferno Titan and Stormbreath Dragon. It also utilizes cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Nissa, Vital Force for card advantage and additional pressure. The inclusion of Blood Moon further punishes decks heavily reliant on non-basic lands.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Burning-Tree Emissary and Experiment One to accelerate the board presence. With a mix of efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Wild Nacatl, supported by a fast mana base and powerful spells like Atarka's Command and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of early aggression and burn spells to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.
